content:
Sounds like a great plan! Prepping healthy snacks on the weekend can really help you stay on track during the busy weekdays. Here are some delicious and nutritious snack ideas that pair well with an afternoon cup of coffee:

**Fresh Fruit and Nut Combinations**

1. Apple slices with almond butter and a sprinkle of cinnamon
2. Berries with chopped walnuts and a drizzle of honey
3. Banana slices with peanut butter and a sprinkle of sea salt

**Energy Balls**

1. No-bake energy balls made with oats, nuts, seeds, and dried fruits
2. Coconut macaroon energy balls with dark chocolate chips

**Protein-Rich Snacks**

1. Greek yogurt with honey and mixed berries
2. Hard-boiled eggs with a sprinkle of paprika
3. Edamame with sea salt and a squeeze of lemon

**Crunchy Delights**

1. Roasted chickpeas seasoned with cumin and chili powder
2. Kale chips with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese
3. Trail mix with nuts, seeds, and dried cranberries

**Granola and Energy Bars**

1. Homemade granola bars with rolled oats, nuts, and dried fruits
2. Energy bars made with dates, nuts, and seeds

**Veggie Sticks with Hummus**

1. Carrot and celery sticks with classic hummus
2. Cucumber slices with dill hummus
3. Bell pepper strips with roasted red pepper hummus

**Other Options**

1. Infused water with fruits and herbs (e.g., strawberry and basil or lemon and mint)
2. Dark chocolate-dipped apricots or cranberries
3. Cottage cheese with sliced cucumber and mint

These snacks are all easy to prepare, healthy, and pair well with an afternoon cup of coffee. You can also customize them to fit your dietary preferences and ingredient availability. Enjoy your snack prep and happy cooking on the weekend!
